title: fish: spack load displays warning message

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
When you run `spack load` with the `fish` shell, it displays a warning message. This can also be seen in [Spack's CI tests](https://github.com/spack/spack/runs/1069407405?check_suite_focus=true).

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ source $SPACK_ROOT/share/spack/setup-env.fish
$ spack install zlib
$ spack load zlib
```

### Error Message

Here is the warning message from our CI tests:
```console
set: Warning: $PATH entry "/home/runner/work/spack/spack/var/spack/environments/spack_test_env/.spack-env/view/bin:/home/runner/work/spack/spack/bin:/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.8.5/x64/bin:/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.8.5/x64:/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/bin:/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/sbin:/usr/share/rust/.cargo/bin:/home/runner/.config/composer/vendor/bin:/home/runner/.dotnet/tools:/snap/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games:/usr/local/games" is not valid (No such file or directory)
set: Did you mean 'set PATH $PATH /home/runner/work/spack/spack/bin:/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.8.5/x64/bin:/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.8.5/x64:/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/bin:/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/sbin:/usr/share/rust/.cargo/bin:/home/runner/.config/composer/vendor/bin:/home/runner/.dotnet/tools:/snap/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games:/usr/local/games'?
```

### Information on your system

The warning from our CI is from Spack develop, the latest Ubuntu, and Python 3.8.

### Additional information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

This issue was originally reported to me by @sbaks0820

@JBlaschke @pat-s @gonsie you're all known Spack + Fish users, any idea what's up here?
